name: awscli
author: Amazon Web Services
helpMarkDown: The AWS Command Line Interface is a unified tool to manage your AWS services. With just one tool to download and configure, you can control multiple AWS services from the command line and automate them through scripts.

inputs.name: AWSConnection
inputs.label: AWS service endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the AWS endpoint to use. If needed, click on 'manage', and add a new Service Endpoint of type 'AWS'

inputs.name: awsCommand
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The AWS CLI command to run. Run `aws help` to get complete list of commands or refer to: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/command-structure.html

inputs.name: awsSubCommand
inputs.label: Subcommand
inputs.helpMarkDown: The AWS CLI command to run. Run `aws help` to get complete list of commands or refer to: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/command-structure.html

inputs.name: awsArguments
inputs.label: Options and parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: The arguments to pass to the AWS CLI command. Run `aws <command> --help` to get complete list of arguments supported by the command.

inputs.name: failOnStandardError
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the StandardError stream.
